course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Modern Chinese Fiction (1917-1949)
course.description: A historical and critical survey of modern Chinese fiction from 1917 to 1949, with emphasis on the forms of novella and short story.

reviews.author: 快樂肥仔
reviews.title: Nice
reviews.comment_content: Some famous modern Chinese fictions and poems are analysed in this course, and the prof tries to focus on how "dreams" are created in these stories. If you love reading (even if you have read those books before), you are strongly recommended to enrol in this course given that some special perspectives can be found during the discussions.
reviews.comment_teaching: The prof would raise a few questions related to the fictions and the dreams of the writers (or main characters), but he expected that students would be the one answering these questions. Some classmates were too active that I couldn't even get a chance to speak:)
reviews.comment_grading: Quite nice, I finished this course with a serious attitude and I got an A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
Weekly assignment: Feedbacks regarding the assigned readings
at the end of the semester: you can write a song or write a story (whatever you want), as long as it's related to "dream"

reviews.author: Leo Hui
reviews.title: Spending so much time but class is okay
reviews.comment_content:
This course is taught in Putonghua.

It mainly introduce the fiction created within the period AD 1917- 1949 in China.
The professor would divide the period into three part to introduce. The previous comment have listed out all of the content. Therefore I would not repeat.
It is quite boring listening to those classic fiction for us, especially for student who are not interested in literature.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The content is boring but professor is okay.
He realize that some of you are reluctant to listen to same content and same voice day by day. Therefore, sometimes he would play some video in class to help you to know the story of the novels.
Professor does not really mind that you are late or absent, but you better not to do that so frequently and you would miss particular information.
The professor is from China, but you don't need to say something to show that you love the major party in China so much.
reviews.comment_grading:
There is no assignment therefore we just have midterm and final exam in the semester.
Grading
In-class performance: 10%
Midterm exam: 40%
Final exam: 50%

I got twenty something over forty in midterm and about forty something in final, I got a A- grading in the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is quite much if you really read those novels he gave, since every fictions is quite thick and you would spend so much time on it. Besides reading, no extra assignment are required. There are just 2 test, one is midterm and one is final exam.
In conclude, if you want to get good result in this course, it would cost you so much time.
Since sometime the classmates are quite competitive, you may feel pressure after exam.

reviews.author: Mandie
reviews.title: Don't enroll unless you are a Chinese fiction fever
reviews.comment_content:
課程主要介紹 1917-1949 之間中國現代小說發生、發展的基本狀況及特點,特 別閱讀幾位影響較大的作家作品。少量閱讀一些研究著作,輔助理解文學文本。

Week 1 導論及第一個十年(1917-1927)

必讀:胡適:<文學改良芻議>,陈独秀<文學革命論>

推薦閱讀:王德威:<序:小說中國>,《想象中國的方法》,北京:生活.讀書.新 知三聯書店,1998;夏志清著、劉紹銘等譯:<現代中國文學感時憂國的精神>, 《中國現代小說史》,香港:中文大學出版社,2001。

Week 2 魯迅《吶喊》
必讀:<自序>、<狂人日記>、<孔乙己>、<社戲>

推薦閱讀:錢理群:《魯迅作品十五講》,北京:北京大學出版社,2003;汪暉: 《反抗絕望──魯迅及其文學世界》,北京:生活.讀書.新知三聯書店,2008。

Week 3 魯迅《吶喊》
必讀: <阿Q正傳>

推薦閱讀:夏濟安:《黑暗的閘門》,香港:中文大學出版社,2015;李歐梵: 《鐵屋中的吶喊》,北京:生活.讀書.新知三聯書店,1991。

Week 4 魯迅《彷徨》
必讀:<祝福>、<在酒樓上>、<傷逝>、<孤獨者>

推薦閱讀:竹內好著、李心峰譯:《魯迅》,杭州:浙江文藝出版社,1986;藤 井省三著、陳福康譯:《魯迅比較研究》,上海:上海外語教育出版社,1997。

Week 5 鴛鴦蝴蝶派、問題小說、自敘傳小說

必讀:徐枕亞<玉梨魂>(節選)、冰心<斯人獨憔悴>、郁達夫<沉淪>

推薦閱讀:Haiyan Lee: Revolution of the Heart: A Genealogy of Love in China, 1900-1950. Stanford University Press, Introduction


Week 6 第二個十年(1928-1937)、茅盾

必讀:茅盾<子夜>(節選)

推薦閱讀:陳建華《革命與形式──茅盾早期小說的現代性展開》,上海:復旦大學出版社,2007。


Week 7 老舍及巴金
必讀:老舍<駱駝祥子>、巴金<家>

推薦閱讀:吳福輝、錢理群主編:《老舍自傳》,南京:江蘇文藝出版社,1995. 陳思和、周立民編:《解讀巴金》,沈陽:春風文藝出版社,2002。


Week 8 沈從文
必讀:沈從文<邊城>

推薦閱讀:金介甫著、符家欽譯:《鳳凰之子──沈從文傳》,北京:中國友誼 出版公司,1999。

Week 9 京派、海派及通俗小說

必讀:廢名<橋>、穆時英<上海狐步舞>、張恨水《啼笑因緣》

推薦閱讀:杨义:《京派文学与海派文学》,上海:上海三联书店,2007。





Week 10 第三個十年(1937-1949)、趙樹理

必讀:毛澤東:<在延安文藝座談會上的講話>、趙樹理:<小二黑結婚>

推薦閱讀:錢理群:<關於 20 世紀 40 年代大文學史研究的斷想>,《中國現代 文學論叢》,2005.1;张霖:<趙樹理與新文化的通俗化實踐>,《中國現代文 學論叢》,2009.2。


Week 11 張愛玲
必讀:張愛玲<沉香屑.第一爐香>、張愛玲<傾城之戀>

推薦閱讀:夏志清著、劉紹銘等譯:《中國現代小說史》第十五章<張愛玲>,香 港:中文大學出版社,2001。


Week 12 張愛玲
必讀:張愛玲<金鎖記>、<封鎖>

推薦閱讀:王德威:<半生緣一世情──張愛玲與海派小說傳統>,<落地的麥子 不死──張愛玲的文學影響力與“張派”作家的超越之路>,《想象中國的方法》, 北京:生活.讀書.新知三聯書店,1998。


Week 13 總結
reviews.comment_teaching: 老師的教法略為跳脫, 內容量大, 需要自行整合。但歷史性豐富,有趣。
reviews.comment_grading:
出席及課程表現 10%
期中測驗 40%
期末測驗 50%

期中測驗,期末測驗主要是fill in the blanks+ short essay about the contents of the fictions(that means 背)
期中測驗:28/40
期末測驗:40/50
Final Grade: B+
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is little if you had already read those fictions. Finals and midterms based on the content of the fiction and analysis towards it. You must need to read through the fictions before you attend the classes.
